body:
The biggest problem with this is that it would add an additional field to each cell, tracking the color of the underline, which would have a decent impact on memory usage (about 8%). This of course affects everyone, colored underline or not.

I don't think that should necessarily stop us from implementing it, but it would be nice to try and reduce the cell size first before implementing it. That is the main reason it isn't implemented yet. So we should try to free up some space and then it should be a simple choice to use some of that freed up space to store this additional information. The best place for that would likely be the zerowidth character storage.

The recent commit [b904207b1979bb] added support for double underline whilst also doing this:

> Alacritty will now also always fallback to the normal underline in case
any of the other underlines like the undercurl are specified.

A very nice enhancement towards the goal of colored undercurls as noted in this [undercurl feature request](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/1628).

A pathway as outlined by @chrisduerr seems to be:

- First reduce cell size

- Second use the freed up space, say in zerowidth character storage, to store color underline details separate from the character they sit beneath.

Folks like myself who want colored undercurls would instead get colored underline which are almost as good. Colored underline/undercurl is very useful for spelling and lint/diagnostic errors in terminal editors such as (Neo)vim.

I am a proponent of this development path and I hope it does eventuate.
The cell size was reduced in https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/commit/ec42b42ce601808070462111c0c28edb0e89babb
Fantastic. One step along the path. Many thanks.

issue.title: Add colored underline support
issue.body:
Fixes #4142

Support colored underline, according to [kitty's protocol extension](https://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/protocol-extensions.html#colored-and-styled-underlines). When a different underline color is specified, it stays the same under color inversion when selecting, but it follows the foreground color when it is not.

issue.title: Add options and arguments for display-menu to set border, border style, and style
issue.body:
~~:warning: The merge base of this PR should be [`afh:afh-popup-style-arguments`](https://github.com/afh/tmux/tree/afh-popup-style-arguments) from #2931 instead of [`tmux:master`](https://github.com/tmux/tmux). :information_source: To see only the relevant changes please compare [`afh:afh-popup-style-arguments` with`afh:afh-menu-style-opts-args`](https://github.com/afh/tmux/compare/afh-popup-style-arguments...afh:afh-menu-style-opts-args?expand=1).~~ Update: #2931 has been applied, so master as a merge base for this PR is now correct This PR brings the same styling capabilites from popup to menu. To test: * Build and run tmux `./tmux -vv -f/dev/null -Ltest` * Set menu-border-lines, menu-style options and display menu (see `test_menu_style.sh` below) * Use `-B`, `-b`, `-s, `-S` arguments when displaying a menu (see `test_menu_style.sh` below)
test_menu_style.sh ``` #!/bin/ksh ./tmux set -gwU menu-border-lines ./tmux set -gw menu-border-lines double ./tmux set -gw menu-border-style fg=black,bg=yellow ./tmux set -gw menu-style fg=magenta,bg=cyan ./tmux set -gw mode-style fg=yellow,bg=black ./tmux menu -T 'Styled via Options' '#[fg=red,bg=blue]foo' '' '' -bar '' '' '' baz '' '' ./tmux menu -B -T 'Styled via Options' '#[fg=red,bg=blue]foo' '' '' -bar '' '' '' baz '' '' ./tmux menu -b heavy -S fg=blue,bg=red -s fg=magenta,bg=cyan -T 'Styled via Arguments' foo '' '' -bar '' '' '' baz '' '' ./tmux menu -B -b heavy -S fg=blue,bg=red -s fg=magenta,bg=cyan -T 'Styled without Border' foo '' '' -bar '' '' '' baz '' '' ```

issue.title: Add colored underline support
issue.body:
This commit adds support for colored underline by packing all the cell
colors and using the mask to access them, so it keeps the cell in the
same size of 24 bytes, but have colored underlines being statically
allocated on the cell.

Fixes #4142.

--

That's what I managed to get on my machine.
